intro: Conyza runcinata, commonly known as the common ragwort, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world, including North America. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Conyza runcinata is an annual or biennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
